review: "Death Note, Vol. 3" is a compelling addition to the series, known for its intricate plot and deep character development. The cat-and-mouse game between L and Light/Kira is masterfully crafted, creating a tense and thrilling narrative. The artwork is top-notch, enhancing the dark and captivating atmosphere. While the plot can be complex and convoluted, it adds to the overall suspense and keeps you engaged. The character development, particularly the metaphor of the game of tennis, is well-executed and adds depth to the story. Despite a few moments that may require close attention, it aligns well with my preferences for mature themes and strong emotional impact."
